articles.content: Context-dropping is one of the chief psychological tools of evasion. In regard to one’s desires, there are two major ways of context-dropping: the issues of range and of means.
articles.attribution:
“The ‘Conflicts’ of Men’s Interests,”
The Virtue of Selfishness, 51

articles.content:
Whenever you tear an idea from its context and treat it as though it were a
self-sufficient, independent item, you invalidate the thought process involved.
If you omit the context, or even a crucial aspect of it, then no matter what
you say it will not be valid . . . .
articles.attribution:
Leonard Peikoff,
The Philosophy of Objectivism lecture series, Lecture 5
